intro: Diplocaulobium mamberamense, commonly known as the Mambera dwarf sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetland or marshy environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads that are usually green or brown in color. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
